intro: Calyptranthes racemosa, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and usually elliptical in shape, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Calyptranthes racemosa thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in coastal and lowland areas of Hawaii.
